title: How to Make Striped Popsicles

steps.headline: Choose your first flavor and fill a third of an ice lolly mould with it.
Cover the cup in foil then stick a popsicle stick into the top.
Leave it in the freezer for an hour.
Pick your next flavor and fill the another third of the ice lolly mould.
steps.description: You may remove the foil at this point because the stick should stand on its own.

steps.headline: Leave it in the freezer for an hour.
Pick your final flavor and fill the last third of the mould.
Leave it in the freezer for a few hours.
Put the strawberries, water and stevia into the blender.
Mix the coconut milk and vanilla extract together in a separate bowl.
Pour the strawberry purée into the popsicle mould.
steps.description: Fill it to 1/3 of the way. Place in the freezer for about 45 minutes to 1 hour.

steps.headline: Remove the frozen popsicles from the freezer.
steps.description: Spoon the coconut mixture into the frozen molds, another third of the way. Return to the freezer. Add the popsicle sticks at this stage. Freeze another 30 to 45, or minutes until firm-ish but not too firm. Work quickly to prevent the first layer from thawing.

steps.headline: Remove the popsicles from the freezer.
steps.description: Pour the final layer of strawberry purée. Fill the the end level of the mold's suggested capacity. Return to the freezer.

steps.headline: Freeze until fully firm.
Serve.
steps.description: The end result will be striped strawberries and cream popsicles that are delicious.

methods.name: Strawberry, Kiwifruit and Peach Striped Popsicles

steps.headline: Add the strawberries and 1/4 cup of honey into a blender or food processor.
Pour the strawberry purée into the cups or popsicle moulds.
Place in the freezer.
steps.description: Leave for about 30 minutes, or until they are firm.

steps.headline: Clean the blender or food processor.
steps.description: Add the kiwifruit and another 1/4 cup of honey. Pulse or blend into a purée.

steps.headline: Pour the kiwifruit pulse into the cups or moulds.
steps.description: Fill another third of the way. Add the popsicle sticks at this stage. Place in the freezer until firm.

steps.headline: Clean the blender or food processor.
steps.description: Add the peach flesh and the last 1/4 cup of honey. Pulse or blend into a purée.

steps.headline: Pour the peach purée in the remaining part of each cup or mould.
steps.description: Place in the freezer to freeze until firm.

steps.headline: Serve when the popsicles have frozen solid.

text: Choose-Your-Ingredients Striped Popsicle Choose your first flavor and fill a third of an ice lolly mould with it.  Cover the cup in foil then stick a popsicle stick into the top.  Leave it in the freezer for an hour.  Pick your next flavor and fill the another third of the ice lolly mould. You may remove the foil at this point because the stick should stand on its own. Leave it in the freezer for an hour.  Pick your final flavor and fill the last third of the mould.  Leave it in the freezer for a few hours.  Strawberries and Cream Striped Popsicles Put the strawberries, water and stevia into the blender. Blend until puréed. Mix the coconut milk and vanilla extract together in a separate bowl.  Pour the strawberry purée into the popsicle mould. Fill it to 1/3 of the way. Place in the freezer for about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Remove the frozen popsicles from the freezer. Spoon the coconut mixture into the frozen molds, another third of the way. Return to the freezer. Add the popsicle sticks at this stage. Freeze another 30 to 45, or minutes until firm-ish but not too firm. Work quickly to prevent the first layer from thawing. Remove the popsicles from the freezer. Pour the final layer of strawberry purée. Fill the the end level of the mold's suggested capacity. Return to the freezer. Freeze until fully firm.  Serve. The end result will be striped strawberries and cream popsicles that are delicious. Strawberry, Kiwifruit and Peach Striped Popsicles Add the strawberries and 1/4 cup of honey into a blender or food processor. Blend or pulse until puréed. Pour the strawberry purée into the cups or popsicle moulds. Fill about 1/3 of the way. Place in the freezer. Leave for about 30 minutes, or until they are firm. Clean the blender or food processor. Add the kiwifruit and another 1/4 cup of honey. Pulse or blend into a purée. Pour the kiwifruit pulse into the cups or moulds. Fill another third of the way. Add the popsicle sticks at this stage. Place in the freezer until firm. Clean the blender or food processor. Add the peach flesh and the last 1/4 cup of honey. Pulse or blend into a purée. Pour the peach purée in the remaining part of each cup or mould. Place in the freezer to freeze until firm. Serve when the popsicles have frozen solid.
